intro: Bletia venosa, commonly known as the velvet orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, velvety purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Bletia venosa has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb nutrients from the soil. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is appreciated for its ornamental value in horticulture.
